html.p: This is intended as a general use dashboard to help you troubleshoot any issues you may be having with jobs. You can use the dropdown to filter logs based on worker group, job name and job id. Improvements to our job logging will be made in future releases which will result in more useful job metrics. For now, we are providing you with just a list of logs.

fieldset.input:
>Host host host
| tstats values(host) AS host WHERE `set_cribl_internal_log_index` AND source IN ("*state/jobs/*") | mvexpand host | sort host $time.earliest$ $time.latest$

search.query: | tstats values(source) AS source WHERE `set_cribl_internal_log_index` AND source IN ("*state/jobs/*") AND host=$host$ | mvexpand source | rex field=source "state\/jobs\/(?<WorkerGroup>.*?)\/(?<JobId>.*?)\/" | stats values(WorkerGroup) AS WorkerGroup | mvexpand WorkerGroup

| tstats values(source) AS source WHERE`set_cribl_internal_log_index` AND source IN ("*state/jobs/*") AND host=$host$ | mvexpand source | rex field=source "state\/jobs\/(?<WorkerGroup>.*?)\/(?<JobId>.*?)\/" | rex field=JobId "^.*\d+\.\d+\.(scheduled|adhoc|system)\.(?<JobName>.*)" | search WorkerGroup=$workerGroup$ | stats values(JobName) as JobName | mvexpand JobName

| tstats values(source) AS source WHERE`set_cribl_internal_log_index` AND source IN ("*state/jobs/*") AND host=$host$ | mvexpand source | rex field=source "state\/jobs\/(?<WorkerGroup>.*?)\/(?<JobId>.*?)\/" | rex field=JobId "^.*\d+\.\d+\.(scheduled|adhoc|system)\.(?<JobName>.*)" | search WorkerGroup=$workerGroup$ AND JobName=$jobName$ | stats values(JobId) as JobId | mvexpand JobId | sort 0 - JobId
